Symptoms.Name: Obsessive thoughts
Questions: Do you find yourself repeatedly thinking about the same thing, even when trying to focus on something else?
Do you feel anxious or distressed because of recurring unwanted thoughts?
Symptoms.Advice: Practice mindfulness techniques to observe your thoughts without judgment and seek professional counseling if needed.

Symptoms.Name: Compulsive behaviors
Questions: Do you feel compelled to perform certain rituals or actions repeatedly, even when you know they are unnecessary?
Do you find it difficult to stop yourself from engaging in repetitive behaviors?
Symptoms.Advice: Work with a therapist to identify triggers and develop coping strategies to reduce compulsive behaviors.

Symptoms.Name: Difficulty accepting uncertainty
Questions: Do you struggle to tolerate uncertainty in daily life?
Do you find yourself excessively seeking reassurance from others?
Symptoms.Advice: Gradually expose yourself to uncertain situations and practice accepting outcomes without seeking excessive reassurance.

Symptoms.Name: Perfectionism
Questions: Do you feel an overwhelming need to make everything perfect?
Do you find it hard to complete tasks because they never meet your standards?
Symptoms.Advice: Set realistic goals and remind yourself that imperfections are a natural part of life.

Symptoms.Name: Avoidance behaviors
Questions: Do you avoid certain places, people, or tasks because they trigger obsessive thoughts or compulsive actions?
Do you find yourself withdrawing from activities you used to enjoy?
Symptoms.Advice: Gradually confront avoided situations in a controlled manner with the support of a therapist.

Rules.Action: Recommend cognitive-behavioral therapy to address both obsessive thoughts and compulsive actions.
Encourage practicing mindfulness and tolerance for uncertainty through guided exercises.
Suggest setting achievable goals and working gradually to re-engage in avoided activities.
